referred_to_by.content: American, Sun Prairie, Wisconsin 1887–1986 Santa Fe, New Mexico

The quality of light in New Mexico enabled O'Keeffe to see clearly over great distances. Even in small paintings such as this she conveyed that expansiveness, emphasizing the successive rows of sand hills seen from a somewhat elevated perspective.
Inscription: Signed and dated (verso): Georgia O'Keeffe—1930
the artist (1930–63; on extended loan to MMA, 1949–63; her gift as part of the Alfred Stieglitz Collection to MMA)

New York. An American Place. "Georgia O'Keeffe: Recent Paintings, New Mexico, New York, Etc, Etc.," January 18–February 27, 1931, no catalogue (checklist, one of nos. 24–33, as " Landscape near H & H Ranch, toward Abiquiu, N. "Georgia O'Keeffe: 1887–1986," November 19, 1988–February 5, 1989, not in catalogue (unnumbered checklist addendum).Los Angeles County Museum of Art. "Georgia O'Keeffe: 1887–1986," March 30–June 18, 1989, not in catalogue.Tacoma Art Museum. "In Search of Sunsets: Images of the American West 1850 to Present," September 12–November 22, 1992, unnum. brochure.Albany. New York State Museum. "Twentieth-Century American Landscapes from The Metropolitan Museum of Art," May 29–November 4, 2001, no catalogue.Santa Fe. Georgia O'Keeffe Museum. "O'Keeffe and New Mexico: A Sense of Place," June 11–September 14, 2004, no. 8.Columbus Museum of Art, Columbus, Ohio. "O'Keeffe and New Mexico: A Sense of Place," October 1, 2004–January 16, 2005, no. 8.Buffalo. Albright-Knox Art Gallery. "O'Keeffe and New Mexico: A Sense of Place," January 27–May 8, 2005, no. 8.Albany. New York State Museum.
